THE HERO, INDRAN (MATHIVANAN SAKTHIVEL) IS A WRITER WHO MEETS A BLIND GIRL, PRAMILA (MAHASHRI). INDRAN USES THE ISSUES THAT PRAMILA HAVE AS A PLOT FOR HIS NOVEL. IN THIS JOURNEY HE EXPLORES SOME THRILLING EVENTS
Satya works for Lahoti, a construction magnate. Gradually, he starts carrying out assassinations, gains immense power and loses his loved ones in the process.
Upon challenging guru, a dominant gangster, Sathya is forced to move out of his city. However, when he returns as a DSP, Sathya pledges to seek revenge.
A boy with autism lives with his mother, while a young woman is abducted by an unknown group. Their paths are about to cross in unexpected ways.
A fugitive gangster, an amateur guitarist planning to assassinate a politician, and a fisherman in love with an unattainable woman—three men, all named David, who are connected in an unexpected way.
Dheena works for his brother Adhikesavan, a gangster, and is very close to him. However, things turn sour between them after a misunderstanding leads to the death of their sister.
Three cousins, Arjun, Divya and Kannan, relocate to Bangalore for various reasons. However, they face many challenges which change their lives forever.

Veyil is about a troubled youngster raised by his widowed mother. He shares a complex bond with his brother, best friend, and others. Karthi and Sidhu live with their mother, and the story follows how they face life’s challenges together, showing their struggles, relationships, and family strength.
Muthiah and Visalakshi lead a happy life when Saroji a young woman seeks refuge in their house. Muthaiah develops a soft corner for Saroji which invites plenty of trouble in their family .
Indresh meets Vidhyak as Sarvesh is arrested and jailed. Meanwhile, Ankita grows furious with her in-laws over their decisions, escalating family tensions.
A charming flirt who has never been in a serious relationship with anyone finds himself in unfamiliar territory when he finally falls in love with a woman.
The lives of Sairam, Gayathri, Abhiram and Mahitha, who are four middle-class individuals, collide as they pursue their individual ambitions amidst various challenges.
A couple sets out on a road trip but gets stranded in the middle of nowhere when their car breaks down. Soon, they take help from a stranger, unaware that he is a psychopath.
AFTER BEING MOLESTED BY VAMSI, A POLITICIAN'S SON, PALLAVI, ALONG WITH HER FRIENDS, IS UNABLE TO LODGE A COMPLAINT AGAINST HIM. HOWEVER, AN ALCOHOLIC LAWYER, SATYADEV, COMES TO THEIR RESCUE.
WHEN THREE NOTORIOUS CRIMINALS LOCK HORNS WITH A HOT-TEMPERED POLICE OFFICER, POTHARAJU SHANKAR, LITTLE DO THEY KNOW THAT THEY WILL END UP BEHIND BARS.
AFTER HIS MOTHER'S DEATH, PREM, A YOUNG MAN, SEARCHES FOR LOVE IN EVERY WOMAN HE COMES ACROSS. HOWEVER, WHEN HE FINDS TRUE LOVE IN THEERA, THEY FACE SEVERAL CHALLENGES IN THEIR QUEST TO UNITE.
ADITYA, A CONMAN, IS FALSELY ACCUSED OF BEING A TERRORIST BY HIS LOVER AND SENTENCED TO DEATH. HOWEVER, IN PRISON, HE LEARNS CHESS AND BECOMES A CHAMPION WHILE FIGHTING HIS WRONGFUL CONVICTION.
SANTOSH STRUGGLES WITH A PSYCHOLOGICAL PROBLEM CALLED MICROPENIS SYNDROME. AS A RESULT, HE KEEPS AVOIDING CONSUMMATING HIS MARRIAGE AND SEEKS THE HELP OF A GODWOMAN TO CURE HIM.
RAMANUJAM, WHO SUFFERS FROM MULTIPLE PERSONALITY DISORDER, WORKS AS A LAWYER BY DAY AND A VIGILANTE AT NIGHT. HE USES TIPS FROM THE 'GARUDA PURANA' AS HIS TOOLS TO EXPOSE VARIOUS ANTISOCIAL ELEMENTS.
A POLICE OFFICER IN THE HOMICIDE INTERVENTION TEAM MUST OVERCOME HIS STRUGGLES WITH HIS TRAGIC PAST IN ORDER TO INVESTIGATE A CASE INVOLVING A MISSING WOMAN.

Shiva, an intelligence officer, develops a phone software that helps him track those in need of help. He sets out to save the people of hyderabad when he realises that a serial killer is on the loose.
Karnan is a corrupt police inspector who often bends the rules to serve his own interests, but after a life-changing event, he realigns his morals and sets out to do the right thing.
A major tragedy forces a self-centred businessman to look back at the prominent moments in his life which built the foundation for his success and thank the people who helped him.
A YOUNG MAN TRIES TO FIND A BALANCE BETWEEN HIS LOVE INTEREST AND FRIENDS. MEANWHILE, HIS FRIENDS CONVINCE HIM TO STAY ROWDY.
Devadas, who suffers from fetal alcohol syndrome, must drink a certain amount of alcohol to keep himself alive. However, things take a turn when he falls in love with Suvasana.
A police officer in the homicide Intervention team must confront his tragic past in order to investigate the disappearance of a woman.
After his mother's passing, Prem, a young man, seeks love in every woman he meets. However, when he finally discovers true love with Theera, they must overcome numerous obstacles to be together.
A petty thief gains great wealth by pretending to be a baba. However, he has a change of heart after falling in love but finds himself getting pushed deep into the world of crime.
Shankar, an assassin, is on the run after murdering a politician. When a twist of fate gives him the memories of a slain police officer, he must help the authorities find a murderer.

Poorna, an aspiring cricketer, spirals into deep depression after being abandoned by his lover, Anshu. Despite his heartbreak, he is compelled to marry his neighbor, Sravani, who has secretly loved him all along.
Aditya, a cunning conman, is falsely accused of terrorism by his lover and sentenced to death. Behind bars, he discovers chess, mastering the game while battling to prove his innocence.

SAPTHAGIRI, a small-time lawyer, reopens a high-profile case in an attempt to gain fame. However, doing so pits him against Sai Kumar, a formidable opponent and one of the best lawyers in the country.
Shakthi, a young man, helps Mathi, a student, exhibit her invention at an educational fair. However, when they are both falsely accused of patent violation, he sets out to prove their innocence.
The daughter of a temple cook goes against her family's wishes by making non-vegetarian food to prove that she is a talented chef in her own right.

King Ugrasena of Dhara Nagaram has three daughters—Rupasundari, Hemasundari, and Gunasundari. When asked who they love the most, the elder daughters declare their love for their father above all. But the youngest, Gunasundari, insists she will love her future husband the most, no matter his appearance or condition. Offended, the King marries her off to a hideous and disabled man, Daivadheenam, and exiles them from the palace. When the King falls gravely ill, only the rare diamond "Mahendra Mani" can save him. He sends all three sons-in-law on a quest to retrieve it. Despite his disabilities, Daivadheenam proves his strength, courage, and character. Unknown to all, he is a cursed prince transformed due to his past flaws. His transformation during the journey not only lifts the curse but also wins him honor and love.
Anwar is a consulting criminologist who occasionally assists the Kerala Police. When a string of serial killings occurs in quick succession, he must race against time to find the one responsible.
Oliver Twist, a middle-aged man, tries hard to establish a meaningful connection with his sons through a smartphone. However, when that fails, he desperately looks for other ways to bond with them.
DCP Vijaya Kumar goes into hiding to raise his daughter in a safe environment. However, after her life is threatened by deadly gangsters, he must confront his past to protect her.
Two college students, Arjun and Akshara, get off on the wrong foot and develop an instant hatred for each other. However, they land in a pickle and realize their connection from a past life.
ANJALI VIKRAMADITHYAN, A CBI OFFICER, SETS OUT TO TRACK DOWN A SERIAL KILLER WHO THE POLICE CLAIM TO HAVE KILLED YEARS AGO. HOWEVER, THE INVESTIGATION BECOMES PERSONAL WHEN HE TARGETS HER FAMILY.
WHEN A SKULL IS FOUND IN A PACKAGE, ACP SATHYAJITH GETS TASKED WITH IDENTIFYING THE VICTIM AND FINDING THE KILLER. PARALLELLY, A JOURNALIST, WHO GETS HAUNTED BY A SPIRIT, INVESTIGATES THE MYSTERY.
BHARTHRUHARI was an Indian philosopher and poet. These subhashitalu are filled with morality, ethics, and human behavior.

Aburao, the once well known Songadya, a folk theatre clown, is lured by the glittering world of cinema. Seduced by an actress, he betrays his beloved, who is pregnant by him. Finally Aburao fills his own life with humour which he had always missed. He gains a new and charming life thanks to the daughter born of his beloved.
A emotional and heart-warming glimpse into the antics of Ananya and her eccentric family as they navigate life, love, and laughter in Maharashtra.
अभ्यंकरांच्या घरात अनेक नमुने आणि त्यांचे अनेक उद्योग. आज काय घडतंय अभ्यंकरांच्या घरात.चला पाहूया...
The Abhyankar household is full of interesting characters and their many adventures. What’s happening in the Abhyankar house today? Let’s find out.

The story of 'Mauli' is set in a beautifull township called GEORAI Maharashtra. It�s a story of a father and son�s relationship. Ranu a 8-year-old boy who lives with his father mauli. Story begins when Ranu gets a drawing homework where he is clueless about what to draw, and after a series of incidents he gets an idea and what he draws surprises everyone. We dive into Ranu�s world where he see his father in a very different perspective..

The story of Gauri and Krishna— two ordinary middle-class girls who— as their fate would have it, fall into different circumstances in life. After her husband's fatal accident, Gauri comes to her poor brother in Bombay only to become a sex worker. Krishna tries to help her, but in vain.

Inspector Joshi is a grieving father searching for his daughter Aruna, kidnapped years ago when she was six. In his despair, life converges with a recurring dream in which Joshi pursues a shadowy figure who leads him to ‘Paradise’, a nightclub where teenage girls dance to a leering crowd. He is convinced he will find Aruna there and vows to bring her back to Leela, his broken wife.

Mukta is the story of an upper caste girl and a lower caste boy who struggle against the contradictions of their caste, both in India as well as among a community of Indians who have settled abroad, in a supposedly liberated environment. Mukta is the granddaughter of Abasaheb Kanase-Patil, a veteran of Maharashtra’s co-operative movement. She returns to her ancestral home after spending her entire life in the United States where her parents, Eknath and Yashoda, are settled. But Mukta has always felt alienated in the US and has longed to return to India. A post-graduate scholarship to study sociology makes this possible. At the university she meets Milind Wagh, a fearless student leader and poet, to whom she is drawn, much to the chagrin of her Indian family. When things seem to be on the brink, news arrives that her American friend Julian is expected. Her family is happy, hoping that he will be able to ease the situation.
Hosted by Pradeep Bhide, this programme explores the journey, struggles, experiences and achievements of eminent personalities from various fields.
प्रदीप भिडे यांनी सूत्रसंचालन केलेल्या या कार्यक्रमात विविध क्षेत्रातील नामवंत व्यक्तींचा जीवन प्रवास, संघर्ष,अनुभव आणि कामगिरी यांचा उलगडा होतो.

Ajit Wadekar was a renowned Indian cricketer and cricket administrator who pioneered India's overseas Test successes
and inspired future generations of Indian cricketers

अजित वाडेकर हे प्रख्यात भारतीय क्रिकेटपटू आणि क्रिकेट प्रशासक होते ज्यांनी परदेशात खेळल्या गेलेल्या द्विदेशीय कसोटी मालिकेत यश मिळवले 
आणि भारतीय क्रिकेटपटूंच्या भावी पिढ्यांना प्रेरणा दिली.
या मालिकेत ओवी या लोकसाहीत्यातील अत्यन्त लोभसवाण्या प्रकराच्या निमित्ताने लोकपरंपरेतील विविध प्रकारांचा वेध घेतला आहे.
पहिली माझी ओवी गं या मालिकेच्या पहिल्या भागात पोवाडा या शौर्यरसपूर्ण लोकगायनपरंपरेची ओळख...

एक काळ असा होता की क्लासेसला जाणाऱ्यांची संख्या फार कमी होती. काळ बदलत गेला, तसतसं आता परिस्थिती अशी झाली की जर तुम्ही कोचिंग क्लासला जात नसाल, तर तुमच्या कडे प्रश्न चिन्हांनी बघितलं जातं., इतकी त्याची गरज वाढली आहे का.. आपण विळख्यात अडकलो आहोत. या विषयी अधिक माहिती जाणून घेणार आहोत.. कोचिंग क्लासेसचा विळखा..

The Government has declared the new rules for coaching classes. Are consumers fully aware of them? Are there any loopholes? How to overcome that? This is the topic of this episode. Our experts had detailed discussion on this topic which is helpful for every parent who dreams of a better future for their kids.

list.title: Super Sibling - Meena T & Jayashree T

description.content: Hosted by Kanchan Adhikari this talk Show is based on the life of Celebrity Siblings
Both Jayshree T and Meena T are actress and dancer who predominantly worked in Hindi films.

list.title: DAM HOI JEKRA MEIN OHI GADI KHUNTA

description.content: When fearless police officer Ragini is posted to a small town gripped by fear and lawlessness, she takes on the dreaded gangster Muchchad Singh. With the support of local allies, she wages a relentless battle to end his brutal reign and restore justice.

A police officer seeks revenge after his wife is killed by gangsters, while battling his deep love for her. As emotions run deep, the film blends romance and action in a gripping tale of loss, justice, and redemption.

Gauri is a powerful revenge drama about a woman whose life is shattered when her husband, Lakhan, is murdered and she is exploited by a cruel landlord. Rescued by Arjun, a man who looks like Lakhan, Gauri embarks on a journey of empowerment. Trained by Arjun, she rises from victim to warrior, seeking justice and vengeance against those who wronged her.
"Two feuding families, torn by hate, see their children fall in love. But tragedy strikes, sparking a deadly cycle of revenge. Can love and forgiveness break the chain of violence?

When Vikram returns to his village, he is confronted by the harsh realities of patriarchy and injustice. Determined to make a difference, he courageously takes a stand, fighting for change and justice for all.

Raunak is always reprimanded by his father. As he is upto his antics in college with his friends, he falls in love with a rich girl. He is expected to live up to an image of a wealthy man to impress her. When the truth comes to light she rejects him. How will he win her over?

Raja, a lazy man, marries TV anchor Kajal, but his life changes when he is asked to act as Deepak, a wealthy man who was murdered as they both look alike. Now, he must protect Deepak’s family, find the killers, and handle Kajal’s heartbreak after she sees him marrying Deepak’s fiancée. Will he succeed?
In a village, a mentally challenged son rises to avenge his father's death, exposing a decades-old chit fund scam and its ruthless masterminds. After 25 years, justice finally awakens.

When strange things start occuring in a household Dr Kallu is called, he realises that the newly wed Gayatri is possesed by a super natural power 'Bijli' who is seeking revenge on the person who betrayed her.
Arjun, a fearless police officer, is on a mission to take down a dangerous gangster. But when his mother and sister are kidnapped, the fight turns personal. Can he save them before it’s too late?

"

After his father’s death, Vijay struggles with life’s hardships but finds comfort in Kanchan, eventually falling in love with her. However, Kanchan’s friend Kajal starts developing feelings for Vijay, leading to a complex love triangle. How will fate decide their relationships? Watch the full movie to find out!
"

Sati is set in an Indian village in rural Bengal in 1828. In it, a young, mute, orphaned Brahmin girl (Shabana Azmi) is married off to a banyan tree because her horoscope predicts that she will become a widow at an early age. If the prophecy proves true, she would be considered bad luck for her prospective husband and forced to commit Sati.

The Telefilm 'TATWA-TALASH' revolves around the five members in the Roychowdhury family, namely, Mihir, his wife Shyamali, their son Bablu, and daughter Jhumpa living in a apartment along with their grandmother. The family comes with a mediocre background enjoying city life. They live together happily but often face unhealthy situation like other joint families. Shyamali reacts over little things with her mother-in-law. Mihir decides to send his mother to another place. In absence of the grandmother, Bablu and Jhumpa feel very lonely. In the mean time, Brihaspati comes to live with them in their house as maid servant. Day by day she becomes a member of this family. One day Mihir comes early to home from office due to illness. Mihir senses something wrong in their premises. Brihaspati has gone faint and objects are jumbled on the floor. Neighbors come and call the Police. Police suspects Brihaspati, but Mihir hesitates to file any case to the police but sends her to village home. They all suffer from the trauma of this incident. Out of stress, they blame each other for this incident and reveal so many truths about themselves. Mihir feels that his children are going to a wrong direction in their lives. Shyamali decides to bring back her mother-in-law. Mihir happily brings his mother to home. They live together happily ever after. The telefilm teaches us a moral lesson about the necessity of joint family bonding.

This telefilm shows the sad and disheartening life journey of a young and beautiful Christian girl �Rebela�. Rebela used to dream of becoming a bollywood actress since her childhood, as she was poor in studies. Rebela�s father was rich and adored her very much after her mother passed away. Rebela had been very innocent. She does not have any idea about the harsh reality of the outer world. One day she met Albert, and gradually fell in love with him. Albert used to sing, and make Rebela dance to Goanese songs over liquor at the sea beach. Rebela's father warned her not to trust an unknown guy. One night she decided to escape from home for Mumbai, as Albert promised to take her to Bollywood directors for getting film-offers. After few days of staying at hotels, they suffer from shortage of money. Albert insists Rebela to sell her valuable jewellery to pay the hotel tariff, and blackmailed her emotionally. Soon Rebela became pregnant. Albert got furious at the news, as his family would never accept Rebela as an unmarried pregnant woman. Albert left her alone in the hotel and never returned back. A juggler found Rebela fainted. He takes her to his family members to look after her well in that situation. Rebela's father denies accepting her. She gives birth to a baby boy. Eventually, she takes the life of a sex worker to sustain her livelihood. In the end, Rebela is seen to have lost her child. She finally leaves the place.

A Bengali language feature based on India's struggle for independence from British colonial rule, the story of Shibnath, a freedom fighter who is released from prison after 11 years for murdering a British officer. He has spent a good part of his term in prison asylum. Tahader Katha is the story of his return to home after an arduous struggle.

�Bindu� is a tele-film based on Saratchandra Chattopadhyay�s novel �Bindur Chhele�, directed by Nripen Gangopadhyay. It is a story revolving around three characters: Bindubashini (Srabanti Malakar), Annapurna (Anuradha Ray) and her son Amulya (Samyajit Gangopadhyay). Annapurna�s husband Yadav (Arun Bandopadhyay) goes through a lot of struggle to pay for his younger brother Madhav�s (Goutam De) education. Madhav�s newly-wed wife Bindubashini comes from an affluent family. Bindu is desperate to become a mother and when she gets to take care of Amulya, her motherly instincts kicks in. Annapurna and sister-in-law Bindu share a very bittersweet relationship. Bindu has a lot of love and respect for Annapurna and they both show lots of love and affection towards Amulya. However they constantly fight over Amulya�s upbringing. The quarrels keep on increasing over time and reach a state where it becomes incongruous. The two families ultimately decide to split. This separation creates a series of conflicts between the two estranged families. Bindubashini succumbs to a terminal disease. Annapurna, Yadav and the son decide to resolve all conflicts. The film concludes with Bindu and Annapurna rekindling their lost relationship.

Mansur Mian-R Ghora portrays the journey of Mansur Mian, an elderly man attached to his landau and an aging horse, both symbols of his ancestral legacy. While struggling with emotional and financial conflict, Mansur is pressured by his son, Sirajul to sell his landau to invest in Taxi for better economic stability with a touching, emotional finale.

'Hridaypur Katadur' is a telefilm adapted from a short story written by Samar Mukhopadhyay.This is a story of a child who used to stay with his grandparents at his village home. The boy feels lonely in the bustling city life where he resides now. He is unable to adjust to his parents� busy career. He even feels detached from the grand birthday party of his own. Amidst several other children attending his Birthday bash, he recollects and longs for his days in his ancestral home in village where his grandmother used to arrange a birthday feast in a traditional way. The boy�s guardian is seen to be frustrated at the emotional detachment of her elder son living in the city. The boy spends alone time by watching TV programs when his parents are not at home. One day his uncle pays a visit at their house. The uncle apprehends some uneasiness and disputes between his elder brother and the sister-in-law. He spends quality time with the boy, accompanies him to several places of interest in the city. The boy gets rid of loneliness, but cries out when his uncle leaves for his village home. It turns to solidarity for him again.

Chatujje Barujje is a comic drama. The story revolves around a Boys hostel �Chakroborty Boarding House�. Putiram Chatujje has a shop at Bara Bazar. So he attends his shop for the whole day. Khudiram Barujje works for a newspaper printing house. So he spends the nights outside. Bhabatarini takes advantages of these two�s different working hours, and allocates both of them to a single room without their consent. Didimoni, an unmarried aged daughter of a Jaminder, appoints a matchmaker for finding a groom for her. The matchmaker meets chatujje and Barujje in distinct time and conveys the marriage proposal. One day Chatujje comes early in the day time. Chatujje and Barujje have a face-off. Suddenly they come to know from each other about the marriage proposal. However, at that moment, they don�t know who the bride is. They come to realization that fighting is not a solution to the room-sharing problem. Therefore, they agree to share the room until they get married. The matchmaker takes Chatujje to the ajminder�s house. There he meets Laksmi and falls in love with her at the first sight. At the same time, matchmaker brings Barujje to meet the bride, but he starts liking Saraswati. Both don't like Jaminder's aged daughter. Finally, Barujje and Chatujje succeed to run away from the Jaminder's house along with Lakshmi and Saraswati. These two women had been dependent on Jamindar's house ever since their father got lost in Kolkata. Chatujje and Barujje return to the boarding hostel along with their wives and approach Bhabatarini for support. Chakraborty, along with Bhabatarini, raises several inquiries against Chatujje and Barujje. The drama ended with a twist as Chakraborty Moshai recognizes the girls as his own children. He arranges their marriage with great fanfare.

'Ashamapto Golpo' is a telefilms based on the story written by famous novelist Buddhadeb Basu.This is a story of a village boy who visits Kolkata for higher studies. With the reference of his relative, he got shelter in a professor's house. Gradually he got accustomed to the city life with the help of professor's wife. Besides being a good student he was well versed with current affairs of the nation and soon he becomes involved in student's politics. The professor, however, cannot approve the boy's behavioral changes and decides to leave the house to fix the situation and avoid unpleasant encounters.
A prized family heirloom is about to rip apart lives, loves and faith.
Trapped in a remote location, will a filmmaker and his team escape the unseen and mysterious presence that looms over them?

Aroti's mother and father, Gakul, live a humble and modest life. However, Gakul, consumed by his addiction to alcohol, stoops so low as to sell his own daughter. In the face of relentless hardships and countless adversities, Aroti's mother rises with unwavering strength, ultimately rescuing her daughter from a life of despair. Through sheer determination and resilience, she not only ensures that Aroti becomes a successful doctor but also transforms herself into a thriving entrepreneur. The central theme of the drama 'Aroti' is the powerful and moving journey of a woman who defies all odds to reclaim her dignity and build a better future.

The short film 'Siddhanta....the decision' is based on Youth and their issues. In modern times some youth prefer to live together in relationships to understand one another better before their marriage. Sometimes they takes another decision when they get realised.

Aasha is a gripping tale that follows the life of Aasha, a happily married woman who fulfills all the social obligations of her in-laws' home. Surrounded by love and care, she shares a harmonious relationship with her devoted husband and equally affectionate father-in-law and mother-in-law.However, fate takes a cruel turn when Aasha's husband tragically dies in an accident, causing a dramatic shift in the way those around her perceive her. In a society that often judges widows harshly, Aasha must navigate the weight of societal stigma and find the strength to rise above it.Will she be able to overcome these challenges and reclaim her dignity, or will the pressures of tradition and judgment break her spirit? Watch Aasha as it unravels a poignant journey of resilience, hope, and the quest for normalcy in the face of adversity.With over 7 lakh views on YouTube, Aasha has resonated deeply with audiences, showcasing the complex realities faced by women in the face of personal tragedy.

Aasha is a gripping tale that follows the life of Aasha, a happily married woman who fulfills all the social obligations of her in-laws' home. Surrounded by love and care, she shares a harmonious relationship with her devoted husband and equally affectionate father-in-law and mother-in-law.However, fate takes a cruel turn when Aasha's husband tragically dies in an accident, causing a dramatic shift in the way those around her perceive her. In a society that often judges widows harshly, Aasha must navigate the weight of societal stigma and find the strength to rise above it.Will she be able to overcome these challenges and reclaim her dignity, or will the pressures of tradition and judgment break her spirit? Watch Aasha as it unravels a poignant journey of resilience, hope, and the quest for normalcy in the face of adversity.With over 7 lakh views on YouTube, Aasha has resonated deeply with audiences, showcasing the complex realities faced by women in the face of personal tragedy.

Jyoti is based on social issue for girl child education. We the people go ahead in education. But some parts of our country still not interested in women education. Jyoti also a victim of such situation. But she is able to over come situation by taking help of a superstation. Superstation is always harmful for the society butJyoti takes it as a weapon of education and become successful. The program has gained widespread popularity and has attracted a substantial viewership on YouTube.

Derived from the name Dooars or Dawrang which literally means Gateway, Darrang District has a rich historical and cultural significance in the state of Assam. The name ‘Darrang’ was derived from the Bodo word Dourang, which means 'Lilabhumi' (Playground of Gods). Darrang is home to one of Assam prominent national parks - Orang National Park, which shares its boundary with Sonitpur district. The district contributes immensely to the richness of Assam's culture and civilization.The travelogue will highlight the various temples and other objects of art, speak highly of the artistic genius of our craftsmen. It will showcase tourist destinations which hold import religious significance such as Narikoli Mandir situated in Sipajhar, where travelers pay obeisance before they start their onward journey.Since Darrang has a number of Satras, which are similar to monasteries in structure, established by Sankardeva and later by his followers, the programme will feature the famous ancient shrine Khatara Satra situated in Mangaldai. The Satra is said to be 500 years old and established by Gobinda Ata follower of Mahapurush Sankardev during Koch monarchy. Ojhapali, a form of sacred dance drama, which is very popular among the people of Assam willalso be featured in the travelogue. This form of dance contributes to enrich the colourful heritage of Assam. Another form of dance is the Deudhani nritya which shall also be featured in the programme. One can witness relics of the past displayed all over Darang. It is also known for several other popular religious centres including Bar Masjid, one of the oldest mosques in Darang located in the heart of Mangaldai town and Thaans. Located 16 kms from Mangaldai, Patharughat Swaheed Minar, was established to commemorate the victims of Jallianwala Bagh of Assamese origin. This will be featured in the programme. Another tourist spot is the Gandhi Smriti Park, which is a beautiful lush green park with whiff of freshness and tranquility. Located at the center of Mangaldai town, the park is quite well maintained and at a walking distance from DC's office. The travelogue will show the massive pukhris in the district which are a source of income for the locals. Jaypal Pukhuri, located at Batkaliyajhar Village is a huge pond spread across an area of 20 Bighaas. Known to be established under the rule of King Jaypal, this pond today offers an ideal spot for picnics.

Me dam me phi is a socio-traditional festival celebrated by the Tai-Ahom and people of Assam. The festival has its roots in the ancestral worship of Confucianism in ancient China, which later developed into the Dam-phi (Ancestor worship) tradition of the Tai people .

The mini serial APATYA highlights a burning problem of our society specifically on widow marriage and a kindness of human relationships. A newly married woman unfortunately lost her husband in an accident. Her parents in law survive her in their house as per consent of her own parents. Here, she got a job of teacher and become self-reliant. Her parents in law suggest her to search a life partner for her. Finally, she decided to marry with her colleague. The program has gained widespread popularity and has attracted a substantial viewership on YouTube.

BOLARAM & SABITRI , are very poor and they have extremely limited financial resources , struggling for day to day life lack of basic needs like food, shelter, clothing and health care. Once they are blessed with a girl child after prayers and many rituals and kept her name as Junti, lovingly. Fortunately Junti was an intelligent and brilliant student and her father Bolaram had a strong desire to educate his daughter and wish to see her as an officer .After some time Sabitri, mother of JUNTI became demotivated and asked her husband to stop further schooling and studies of Junti because of their struggling for survival. After a certain point in time mother of Junti began to experience various health problems, lack of financial support and proper treatment could not be provided. Junti stopped going to school and took care of her mother but after a while her mother Sabitri passed away. Bolaram, the father and Junti become very stressed with their hardship.Junti stopped going to school which came to the notice of the school authorities and they sent Naren Sir, (school teacher of Junti) who motivated Bolaram and Junti and promised for all kind of educational support to her. She started her education with more deligently and after few year she stood first in class ten in her Entire district and by the guidance of Naren sir she completed her gradutions and appeared in the Assam Civil Service Examinations . She then becomes the Block development officer of her local township. This way Bolaram fulfilled his dream by educating his child even through such rigorous hardship.
Trikanya' , an anthology that explores the themes of love, lust, and sacrifice through the narratives of three characters: Suman, Saileja, and Bidya, each grappling with different complexities.

Jononi, a homemaker and mother of two, celebrates her 40th birthday, organized by her son Mon and father-in-law. Her husband, Agneev, a corporate head, feels embarrassed by her rural background and sees her only as a housewife. He finds emotional and physical support from a woman at his office. On her birthday, Agneev arrives home late, and as Jononi waits to cut the cake with him, he slaps her surprisingly.

Pari is the story of a girl who is raised by her uncle and aunt in a town. They provide her with all the amenities but Pari s heart longs for her village where she was brown. One day she finally tells her uncle and aunt that she needs to go to her village. They agree to her request with a heavy heart.

Telefim 'Bara' means 'Blessings' centered around 'Sati' a married woman who is navigating the complexities of her personal desires and societal expectations. The story tells about the wonder of inner feelings, desires, wishes of a woman at different junctures of life and its ultimate effects on her. The story ultimately poses a question that, are such blessings, truly blessings or curse.

Biswaprakash’s journey away from home from time to time becomes his endeavour for self realization about the changing value system because of a new consumer culture. He develops friendship with Anjali, an independent young lady who stays along with her mother in an old mansion near the sea. Their relationship comes to an end soon. One day Biswaprakash meets a foreign traveller named June and hopes to escape the claustrophobic town with her. He gradually gets alienated from his friends, family and society. Time comes when June leaves for a new destination and finds Biswaprakash stuck in a no-return situation.

Maguni is a bullock cart driver, who has won the hearts of the people of Khalikote township. One day the news spread that people would no longer ride in Maguni’s cart, because the Singh family plans to ply a motorbus in the town. Much to Maguni’s disappointment, people did prefer the bus. Maguni and his beloved bullocks were reduced to starvation. And then one day, the townsfolk had to force open the door of Maguni’s mean little hut to recover his corpse.

Kedar Babu has been a freedom fighter since the days of Gandhiji's call for the Civil Disobedience Movement. He lost his wife early in their marriage, and since then, he has raised his only son, Sangram, with deep paternal affection. In town, Sangram stays at the house of Zamindar Bahadur Suryakant Singh, where he is gradually exposed to moral decline. This leaves him in a state of dilemma and confusion. In his final encounter with his father, Sangram experiences a new perception of life.

Telefilm 'Gopapura' based on the life of an innocent, god fearing poor couple, Niranjan and his wife, who live their lives with unwavering positivity and faith in a small village. The village had no road connectivity to the nearby town and villagers have to cross the river by boat to reach the town. One day their faith & positivity were put to the ultimate test when their infant son named 'Kanhei' fell ill. The father lost his cool and desperate to save his child. Without fearing about the consequences he himself took the boat with his wife and child and crossed the river with all hardship and finally reached the doctor.

'Nila Mastrani' means 'Teacher Madam Nila' is the poignant story of a young woman, Nila, who endures several hardships in her life. Raised in a small village and belonging to the Brahmin caste, Nila loses her mother at a young age, leaving her to live with her aging father and younger brother. Despite an early marriage, Nila tragically loses her husband within a year and later, her father as well. She takes on the responsibility of caring for her younger brother.Educated and determined, Nila becomes a primary school teacher in her village, gaining respect in her community. However, she falls in love with a man from the washerman caste?a caring and kind-hearted individual. The two defy societal norms by eloping and entering an intercaste marriage. This triggers a wave of gossip and condemnation from the conservative villagers, who eventually boycott the couple.Faced with mounting pressure, Nila is forced to give up her teaching job and adopt her husband's traditional work of washing clothes. Her brother, influenced by societal pressure, also distances himself and does not invite Nila to his wedding. However, both siblings struggle with the separation. One night, in an emotional turn of events, her brother overcomes the fear of village gossip and reunites with his sister.The story addresses themes of child marriage, widowhood, intercaste love, and the rigid societal norms that govern the lives of individuals in traditional rural settings.

A documentary drama which portrays Saheed Baji Rout's entire life journey as a freedom fighter ., Baji Rout was the youngest Indian freedom fighter and martyr, having been killed at the age of twelve, Born in Dhenkanal, Odisha.

'Jeevana Nati' is a telefilm that follows the story of 'Gopala', a kind-hearted and truth-speaking young man who is the seventh and youngest son of a maritime merchant. Gopala is determined to marry only a girl who shares his values of honesty and truthfulness. His parents, in their search, find a perfect match in the King's daughter, who embodies these very qualities.The merchant approaches the King and requests the princess's hand in marriage for Gopala. The King agrees, and the wedding is arranged. However, tragedy strikes when a massive demon appears and, using his magical powers, turns everyone into stone, abducting the princess. The demon's life force resides in a black beetle, which is hidden in a small golden casket deep in the sea, rather than in his body.Undeterred, Gopala sets out on a courageous mission to rescue the princess. Along the way, he encounters and helps two creatures?a turtle and a snake. Impressed by Gopala's kindness and purity of heart, the creatures assist him in discovering the whereabouts of the princess and the secret of defeating the demon. They retrieve the golden casket and present it to Gopala.Armed with the casket, Gopala gains control over the demon and commands him to restore everyone who had been turned to stone. He successfully rescues the princess, bringing joy and peace back to the kingdom. Gopala's bravery, honesty, and kindness triumph, proving that a pure heart can overcome even the greatest of evils.

(Anklet) (Katha Sarita) The ?chest? of the past treasures precious treasures. It is the treasure trove of invaluable memories that connects, past, present and future. Paunji or Anklet, as an integral bead of a series of stories, Katha Sarita, highlights the soothing impact of virgin rural ambience, that harmonizes generations in a joint family. Son-in-law Asit?s insistence on tasting ?Enduri?(a cake), prompts the entire family to visit their native village, after 8 years. There, they feel, the unadultered vibration of rural live. The discovery of Paunji in the wooden chest, after 40 years helps the sister-in-law to revisit the memory Lane. The village-life depicted therein entiances the immortal value of bonding.

Odia Telefilm 'Panu Mishrey' The story revolves around Lokanath, a wealthy and elderly landowner who loses his wife and lives with his only son, Damodar, in a village. Seeking companionship in his old age, Lokanath marries a much younger woman named Malati. However, Malati does not see Lokanath as a romantic partner due to the vast age difference and instead shares a brotherly bond with Damodar. Their close relationship is misunderstood by Lokanath, who becomes suspicious and jealous. One day, in a fit of anger, Lokanath severely beats Damodar, driving him to leave home that very night without informing anyone. By chance, Damodar overhears the name 'Panu Mishra' and mistakenly believes the man is his uncle. He follows him to the town by train. The man, actually a contractor, introduces Damodar to a wealthy merchant who takes Damodar in as a servant. Over time, the merchant and his wife are won over by Damodar?s simplicity, honesty, and strong work ethic. Impressed by his managerial skills and financial acumen, they marry him off to their only daughter, Rama, and Damodar eventually inherits their business and wealth.After some years, Damodar?s father-in-law passes away, and his mother-in-law moves to Puri, a holy town. As the business prospers, Damodar and Rama move to Kolkata. One day, Damodar is struck with thoughts of his father and Malati, which prompt him to return to his village after 10 years. Upon his arrival, he finds his father on his deathbed, consumed by guilt and regret for his past actions. Lokanath confesses his wrongdoings and begs for forgiveness. Damodar also learns that Malati passed away a year after he had left the village. In a heartfelt moment, Lokanath blesses Damodar and Rama before passing away. As they prepare to return to their lives, Damodar realizes that the name 'Panu Mishra,' which had led him away, was actually a mispronunciation of 'Paan Bidi Cigarette,' a simple misunderstanding that changed the course of his life.

Telefilm 'Nishanga Akasha' (Sky of Loneliness) Based on the writings of renowned author Surendra Mohanty?s novels Nishanga Akasha and KrushnaChuda, this telefilm explores the emotional question of whether a person, after chasing success, wealth, and glamour, can return to the innocence of their nostalgic past.The story revolves around Sashikant, affectionately known as 'Mantu' in his childhood, a London-educated engineer and a successful industrialist. He lives in the city with his wife, son, and daughter, enjoying a life of luxury. However, the pressures of work, stress, and office management take a toll on him, leading to hypertension and a deep sense of emptiness. His family doctor advises him to change his routine, lifestyle, and environment to alleviate his health issues. In response, Sashikant decides to return to his childhood village after 30 years of absence. He takes a train to Nayanpur Railway Station, near his native village 'Gudi Banapur.' As he steps back into the village, his childhood memories flood back. He recalls running through the green paddy fields, walking along the village's mud roads, visiting the riverbank, and climbing the hilltops that once filled his youthful days with joy. He also remembers his first love, Nilakain, and the sacrifices of his stepmother, who struggled to manage her land lordship affairs after being widowed and badly needed her son, saving money to fulfill his son's own dream of becoming an engineer. As Sashikant immerses himself in the nostalgia of his past, he reaches his childhood home, only to find that time has not stood still. His childhood love, Nilakain, is now a widow, and his stepmother lies on her deathbed. As Sashikant?s stepmother hears the sound of her son returning home, she takes her last breath and dies, leaving Sashikant feeling utterly helpless. In search of rejuvenation and comfort from his past, Sashikant instead finds more emptiness and loss, realizing that time has changed everything he once cherished. The telefilm poignantly captures his journey of self-reflection, showing how difficult it is to reclaim the innocence and warmth of a bygone era in the face of life's inevitable changes and tragedies.

list.title: Sange Meel Se Mulaqat (Meeting a Milestone)

description.content: The film captures the magic of Bismillah Khan’s music. We see how Bismillah Khan, the phenomenon gradually evolved from a 14-year-old boy accompanying his mamu (uncle) and Guru Nabi Baksh Khan at a concert in Allahabad to become the course of time, one of India’s all-time greats. Through various gripping incidents and anecdotes, we through the evolution of the Shehnai in Indian life and how Benaras is an integral part of the legend’s life and sensibility. For Indian music lovers, Bismillah Khan and music lovers are synonymous with each other. It is truly akin to meeting a milestone, for he occupies a unique place on the endless road of music
IT IS A FICTION BASED ON LOVE STORY OF MAHA PAARA NOOR

A former army officer ignores a colleague’s warning and enters a barber shop owned by a terrorist’s son, stirring tension and unspoken history. He challenges the barber to a wrestling match, which ends with a surprising twist.
In bustling Mumbai, pregnant Aishwarya refuses to listen to her powerful partner Dhruv. A troubled man, Jagruk, steps in to protect her, fighting his fears in a story of bravery and hope.
Action Packed film of a school boy who gets drawn into the dark life of Child Soldiers. Set in the naxalite infested jungles of Bengal.
Roll No. 52 tells the story of a mischievous student who, after his mother wagers on him to pass, realizes her sacrifices when they are evicted from their home, inspiring him to change.

Heer, a teacher grappling with depression, decides to leave her city after a life-altering incident. By chance, a kind-hearted cab driver named Raanjha joins her on this journey, offering his support as she searches for a place where she can find peace. However, will this journey bring her the healing she seeks, or will it lead them toward an unpredictable future?

Renuka, a lively Dalit girl, becomes friends with Ravi, the Zamindar’s son. She challenges societal rules and fights to sit on a special bench, proving her strength in a world that tries to hold her back.
Two children teach us the true meaning of friendship in a colorful and musical film.
Rom-Com about the Love of a man for his car.
Balram hears voices. Torn between the commands that torment him and his love for his daughter he has to choose - To give in or To Protect his daughter.
This riveting film touches upon solitary lives of living scarecrows in villages of Punjab and his life changing effect on a spoilt rich young man.
Documentary of a relationship of a devotee with her Guru Mouni Baba who took a vow of silence for over 50 years. A small tribute to the great man.

list.title: MIHINTALE - THE CRADLE OF BUDDHIST CULTURE

description.content: It is a documentary produced by Sisira Kalawela that describes Mihintale, a mountain peak near Anuradhapura in Sri Lanka. It is believed by Sri Lankans to be the site of a meeting between the Buddhist monk Mahinda and King Devanampiya Tissa, which inaugurated the presence of Buddhism in Sri Lanka. Buddhism plays a central role in shaping thoughts, imagination, and socialization. The social and cultural relations between India and Sri Lanka have had great consequences in art, literature, painting, sculpture, religion, and thought. India has played a very important role in shaping the thought and sensibility of the people of Sri Lanka.

The year 1981 marked the 20th anniversary of the first summit conference of the non-aligned countries, which took place in 1961 in Belgrade. The non-aligned movement has expanded from 25 countries to 94 countries as of 1979, when the VI summit conference was held in Havana. This film, while detailing the history of the non-aligned movement as envisioned by Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru and Marshal Tito, features speeches by Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and Sirimavo Bandaranaike.

list.title: Tourist Gems of Madhya Pradesh ( Madhya Pradesh Ke Darshaniy Sthan )

description.content: This is a camera tour of the well-known towns of Madhya Pradesh like Ujjain, Gwalior and Mandu which have attracted tourists for their architectural beauty and rich historical past

Shrouded in legends and laden with history, Goa has evidence of its eventful march through the corridors of time everywhere. This film vividly depicts this monumental evidence of its past glory in both the temples and the churches.

list.title: Glimpses of India I ( Eastern Region )

description.content: The film shows the life, culture, and economic development of the people of the eastern region of India, which comprises of Assam, Bihar, West Bengal, Nagaland, N.E.F.A. and Manipur.

list.title: Glimpses of India II ( Northern Region )

description.content: The documentary provides a glimpse into the ways of life of people in North India.

Hampi Dreams made of stone The imperial magnificence of the Vijayanagara empire -perhaps the lost magnificient chapter in the history of independent india is the history of Vijayanagara- The ancient city Hampi, proudly stands- flaunting a landmark of rich heritage. with clever hands and passionate heart, they created poetry with hard rocks. We loose ourselves in the gleaming past

The film spans 56 out of Gandhi's 79 years. It starts with his days in South Africa, where Gandhi is seen as a young attorney, who is thrown out of a first class compartment in spite of having a valid ticket. Angered at this humiliation, Gandhi decides to protest for the rights of Indians and other coloured people. It is here that he meets with his first success. His fame spreads to India and he is invited to return home to take part in the freedom struggle. On arrival, he is shocked at the poverty in the country and undertakes to travel all over the country to witness, at first hand, the atrocities of the British Empire. Gandhi's struggle to win freedom for India through his non-violent approach, his belief that men are more good than evil and his spiritual ideas all form a part of this saga, the biography of a fascinating world leader--both spiritual and political.

The expert opinion and storytelling based on the factual Ancient religious scriptures on Mahakal, Ujjain, History of Ujjain, Ujjain in Ancient Literature - Meghdoot by Kalidas Cultural and archaeological heritage of Ujjain, Mahakal Lok corridor , Temples in Avanti Janapada like Mahakal, Kal Bhairav, Ma Harsiddhi Shaktipeeth, Gadh Kalika, Sandipani Ashram, Mangalnath etc. which have ancient and heritage importance. Omkareshwar and Maheshwar (Mahishmati) Main emphasis will be Mahakal and Ujjain. The life of people and culture is centred on Mahakal as he is the lord and Ujjain cannot be segregated in fact owing to its significance to Mahakal.

list.title: Mata Ganga - India's River of Faith

description.content: The documentary traces the journey of the sacred Ganga, from its origin at Gomukh to its confluence with the Bay of Bengal. It explores the river’s mythological significance, its role in shaping ancient civilizations, its importance in Hindu scriptures, and its vast network of tributaries.

Children are told the tale of Mulla Nasruddin and the king by an elderly woman. As Mulla Nasruddin enters the town, he discovers that the king's army taxes everything higher. Everyone is in bad condition.

The episode "We Are All Indians" from Mridang Book - 2 is aimed at class 2 students. It fosters a sense of unity and pride in Indian culture, teaching children about diversity and the shared identity of being Indian.
The video introduces Reena and her daily life, helping kids learn about everyday activities in a fun and engaging way.

The episode 'Daro Mat' from the Saarangi series is designed for class 2 students and draws inspiration from the story of Swami Vivekananda. It encourages children to overcome their fears and instills confidence through engaging storytelling.
The episode "Aloo ki Sadak" from the Saarangi series is designed for class 1 students, blending education with fun. It encourages children to learn through play, fostering creativity and engagement.

list.title: Meena ka Parivaar { Chanda mama door ke}

description.content: The video tells the story of Meena and her family, designed for class 1 students. It includes the traditional song "Chanda Mama Door Ke," teaching children about family bonds through Animation.

The episode "My Name" from Mridang Book - 2 is designed for class 2 students. It engages children in learning through a captivating story, helping them understand the significance of names in a fun and enjoyable way.
Nikita, Nivedita, and Ila, three young girls, want to join the Indian forces. They kept this a secret from their parents. Nikita's father, Col. Arun Sachdev, refused to allow her to join the Navy.
Byomkesh Bakshi wanted to assist the police to  solve the murder case in Chinatown. He looks into the matter and detects the murderers.

Young officers arrive at the Commando School. Old friends meet. Abhimanyu Rai is one of them. The General gives a pep talk. Major Narayanan gets tough. A 2-mile race brings buddies closer. Vikram Rai beats up the three of them and Abhi confesses Vikram is his elder brother.

list.title: Swaraj--Bharat Ke Svatantrata Sangraam Ki Samagr Gaatha

description.content: In 1498, Vasco da Gama's arrival in India sparks cultural clashes and trade negotiations between the Portuguese and the vibrant Indian kingdoms, led by figures like Samoothiri the Zamorin.

In ancient India, visionary strategist Chanakya sets out to overthrow the ruthless King Dhanananda. With unwavering resolve, he mentors the young Chandragupta Maurya, laying the foundation for the mighty Maurya Empire. A powerful tale of ambition, intellect, and the relentless pursuit of a better future.
It is the story of uniting all the princely states after freedom of india by Sardar Patel.

Set in the gritty, rain-soaked landscapes of the rural mithilanchal region of Bihar, a small-town police officer investigates a series of gruesome murders in a remote station called Jackson Halt, each more puzzling than the last.

During the fierce battle in Lanka, the mighty demon Virochak wreaks havoc until Lord Hanuman arrives in his colossal form, carrying Lord Ram and Lakshman, who together slay the demon.
From the peaks of Lanka, Malyavan observes the battle. Upon witnessing Virochak's defeat, he rushes to inform Ravan. At that time, Ravan is seen in his ten-headed form, worshiping Goddess Nikumbhila. When Ravan receives the news of the battle, he prepares to join the fight himself. However, Malyavan advises him that there's no need to intervene as long as his son Meghnad is present. Meghnad then ascends to the sky in his mystical chariot and challenges Lord Ram and Lakshman from above.
ANJALI VIKRAMADITHYAN, A CBI OFFICER, SETS OUT TO TRACK DOWN A SERIAL KILLER WHO THE POLICE CLAIM TO HAVE KILLED YEARS AGO. HOWEVER, THE INVESTIGATION BECOMES PERSONAL WHEN HE TARGETS HER FAMILY.

"The Pickle Factory" is a workplace-family drama following Mahika Khanna, a laid-off MBA graduate, who joins her grandmother's achaar business in Dehradun, navigating quirky coworkers and personal dynamics.
A video game developer's world spirals out of control when his shape-shifting indestructible virtual creation becomes all too real.

A teenage girl discovers her estranged, alcoholic father, a renowned singer, and defies family opposition to save him. Through unconditional love and care, she helps him overcome addiction and reclaim his singing career.
A rush of nostalgia engulfs a travel photographer as he visits his school. However, destiny reunites him with his childhood sweetheart during a school reunion with his friends.
ANJALI VIKRAMADITHYAN, A CBI OFFICER, SETS OUT TO TRACK DOWN A SERIAL KILLER WHO THE POLICE CLAIM TO HAVE KILLED YEARS AGO. HOWEVER, THE INVESTIGATION BECOMES PERSONAL WHEN HE TARGETS HER FAMILY.
JAYAMMA, A DEDICATED HOMEMAKER, GOES TO GREAT LENGTHS TO ENSURE HER FAMILY'S WELL-BEING EVEN AFTER THE STATUS OF HER HOUSEHOLD IS AT STAKE.
MAHESH, A LOWER-MIDDLE-CLASS MISER, FALLS IN LOVE WITH ANITHA, A RICH HEIRESS. HOWEVER, HE IS FORCED TO HOST HER FAMILY INDEFINITELY WHEN A NATIONWIDE LOCKDOWN IS ANNOUNCED.

Rajkumar Nagpal, a work-from-home dad, moves with his wife Devayani and their children, Sanjana and Aditya, from Delhi to Jhansi following Devayani’s job transfer. As they settle into their new home, the neighbors find Rajkumar’s role unusual, which leads to misunderstandings and tension. The family navigates these changes, dealing with challenges from their community and their own personal struggles, as they adapt to their new life.
Cupid strikes when Pritam, a single father, comes across his college sweetheart, Geeta, in Goa. But with their respective children at war with each other, the two find it difficult to reunite.

Uday, a builder, is about to close an important deal but needs a large amount of money to buy the land. He borrows it from an underworld loan shark, but the money is stolen, which puts him in a serious trouble. 
At the same time, people seeking revenge on Chandra, a criminal who is now dead, turn their focus toward Uday. Trapped in danger, Uday must recover his stolen money, protect himself, and clear his name—unaware that an unexpected twist is yet to come.
Kya Masti Kya Dhoom is a lively, high-energy comedy about a group of friends on a wild adventure. It blends humour, drama, and vibrant performances to deliver nonstop entertainment.

After being assaulted by Vamsi, the son of a politician, Pallavi and her friends are unable to file a complaint against him. However, an alcoholic lawyer named Satyadev steps in to help them seek justice.
WHILE SIDDHU AND KARTHI'S MOTHER SINGLE-HANDEDLY RAISES THEM, SHE HARBOURS ANNOYANCE AGAINST HER SONS. THEIR RELATIONSHIP IS TESTED WHEN SOME TRAUMATIC EXPERIENCES DRAW THEM CLOSER TO EACH OTHER.
